Dynamic Languages Symposium (DLS)

Dynamic Languages Symposium 2006  

Co-located with OOPSLA 2006

In cooperation with ACM SIGPLAN

Portland, Oregon, USA, October 23, 2006

http://www.dynamic-languages-symposium.org/dls-06/

  • Presentations of invited talks available...
  • DLS 2006 papers available for download from the ACM Digital Library!

It is our great pleasure to welcome you to the 2nd edition of the Dynamic Languages Symposium (DLS). This symposium is a forum for discussion of dynamic languages, their implementation and application. While mature dynamic languages including Smalltalk, Lisp, Scheme, Self, and Prolog continue to grow and inspire new converts, a new generation of dynamic scripting languages such as Python, Ruby, PHP, and JavaScript are successful in a wide range of applications. DLS provides a place for researchers and practitioners to come together and share their knowledge, experience, and ideas for future research and development. This year we are pleased host invited talks by Ian Piumarta, Audrey Tang, and Avi Bryant.

Robert Hirschfeld
DLS 2006 Program Chair
Hasso Plattner Institute
University of Potsdam
Germany
